main event: Military and civilian observers reported seeing an unusual light in the sky near King Salmon, Alaska on February 7, 1953.
interesting points: The light appeared to be about 20 feet in diameter and made various pulsating movements, disappearing intermittently.
Two observers, a USAF officer and a CAA operations/communications representative, made detailed observations of the light.
The light suddenly accelerated and disappeared from sight within 5-10 seconds.
Mrs. Marcelle L. Adair, a resident of King Salmon, observed a strange reddish-orange to bluish-white light in the sky that was about 10-12 feet in diameter and 25 feet above the ground.

A C-47 aircraft pilot and 1st Lt. William F. Farley, the observer, sighted an unidentified object approximately twice the size of the C-47 flying at an estimated 30,000 feet altitude and moving across the horizon in about 30 seconds.
witnesses: military and civilian observers, including a USAF officer, a CAA representative, and a local resident
